definition: lack of good sense or normal prudence and foresight
examples: his folly in thinking he could not be caught

definition: criminally or tragically foolish actions or conduct

examples: The prank was a youthful folly.

definition: an excessively costly or unprofitable undertaking
examples: Paying so much for that land was folly, since it was all rocks and scrub trees.

definition: an often extravagant picturesque building erected to suit a fanciful taste
